Class ResourceManager

Provides methods for loading resources both at runtime and in the editor; Though, to load at runtime, they have to be in a resources folder

Inheritance

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

AddTextureToMemory(String, Texture2D, String[])

Records an additional texture for the manager memory with optional modifications It's adviced to prepare the texPath using the function before to create a uniform 'path format', because textures are compared through their paths

Declaration
public static void AddTextureToMemory(string texturePath, Texture2D texture, params string[] modifications)

UnityEngine.Texture2D texture
System.String[] modifications

FindInMemory(Texture2D)

Returns whether the manager memory contains the texture It's adviced to prepare the texPath using the function before to create a uniform 'path format', because textures are compared through their paths

GetMemoryTexture(String, String[])

Gets a texture already in manager memory with specified modifications (check with contains before!) It's adviced to prepare the texPath using the function before to create a uniform 'path format', because textures are compared through their paths

Gets a texture already in manager memory with specified modifications (check with 'HasInMemory' before!) It's adviced to prepare the texPath using the function before to create a uniform 'path format', because textures are compared through their paths

GetTintedTexture(String, Color)

Loads up a texture tinted with col, and manages it in a memory for later use. It's adviced to prepare the texPath using the function before to create a uniform 'path format', because textures are compared through their paths

HasInMemory(String, String[])

Whether the manager memory contains a texture with optional modifications It's adviced to prepare the texPath using the function before to create a uniform 'path format', because textures are compared through their paths

| Improve this Doc View Source

LoadResource<T>(String)

Loads a resource in the resources folder in both the editor and at runtime Path can be global, relative to the assets folder or, if used at runtime only, any subfolder, but has to be in a Resource folder to be loaded at runtime

Declaration
public static T LoadResource<T>(string path)where T : Object

LoadResources<T>(String)

Loads a resource in the resources folder in both the editor and at runtime. Path can be global, relative to the assets folder or, if used at runtime only, any subfolder, but has to be in a Resource folder to be loaded at runtime

| Improve this Doc View Source

LoadTexture(String)

Loads a texture in the resources folder in both the editor and at runtime and manages it in a memory for later use. If you don't wan't to optimise memory, just use LoadResource instead It's adviced to prepare the texPath using the function before to create a uniform 'path format', because textures are compared through their paths

Declaration
public static Texture2D LoadTexture(string texPath)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String texPath
Returns
Type Description
UnityEngine.Texture2D
